-- | The request references a routing control that was not found.

-- | Get the state for a routing control. A routing control is a simple
--   on/off switch that you can use to route traffic to cells. When the
--   state is On, traffic flows to a cell. When it's off, traffic does not
--   flow.
--   
--   Before you can create a routing control, you first must create a
--   cluster to host the control. For more information, see
--   <a>CreateCluster</a>. Access one of the endpoints for the cluster to
--   get or update the routing control state to redirect traffic.
--   
--   For more information about working with routing controls, see
--   <a>Routing control</a> in the Route 53 Application Recovery Controller
--   Developer Guide.
module Network.AWS.Route53RecoveryCluster.GetRoutingControlState

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRoutingControlState</a> smart constructor.
data GetRoutingControlState
GetRoutingControlState' :: Text -> GetRoutingControlState

--   to get the state for.
[$sel:routingControlArn:GetRoutingControlState'] :: GetRoutingControlState -> Text

--   fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | Set the state of the routing control to reroute traffic. You can set
--   the value to be On or Off. When the state is On, traffic flows to a
--   cell. When it's off, traffic does not flow.

--   For more information about working with routing controls, see
--   <a>Routing control</a> in the Route 53 Application Recovery Controller

-- | Set multiple routing control states. You can set the value for each

module Network.AWS.Route53RecoveryCluster.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2019-12-02</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Welcome to the Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller API
--   Reference Guide for Recovery Control Data Plane .
--   
--   Recovery control in Route 53 Application Recovery Controller includes
--   extremely reliable routing controls that enable you to recover
--   applications by rerouting traffic, for example, across Availability
--   Zones or AWS Regions. Routing controls are simple on/off switches
--   hosted on a cluster. A cluster is a set of five redundant regional
--   endpoints against which you can execute API calls to update or get the
--   state of routing controls. You use routing controls to failover
--   traffic to recover your application across Availability Zones or
--   Regions.
--   
--   This API guide includes information about how to get and update
--   routing control states in Route 53 Application Recovery Controller.
--   
--   For more information about Route 53 Application Recovery Controller,
--   see the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You can create clusters, routing controls, and control panels by
--   using the control plane API for Recovery Control. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller
--   Recovery Control API Reference</a>.</li>
--   <li>Route 53 Application Recovery Controller also provides continuous
--   readiness checks to ensure that your applications are scaled to handle
--   failover traffic. For more information about the related API actions,
--   see <a>Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller Recovery
--   Readiness API Reference</a>.</li>
--   <li>For more information about creating resilient applications and
--   preparing for recovery readiness with Route 53 Application Recovery
--   Controller, see the <a>Amazon Route 53 Application Recovery Controller
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.Route53RecoveryCluster

-- | API version <tt>2019-12-02</tt> of the Amazon Route53 Recovery Cluster
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | There was a validation error on the request.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You don't have sufficient permissions to query the routing control
--   state.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There was a conflict with this request. Try again.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was denied because of request throttling.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There was an unexpected error during processing of the request.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cluster endpoint isn't available. Try another cluster endpoint.
_EndpointTemporarilyUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request references a routing control that was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRoutingControlState</a> smart constructor.

UpdateRoutingControlState' :: Text -> RoutingControlState -> UpdateRoutingControlState

--   Resource Number (ARN) for the routing control that you want to update
--   the state for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingControlState:UpdateRoutingControlState'</a>,
--   <a>updateRoutingControlState_routingControlState</a> - The state of
--   the routing control. You can set the value to be On or Off.

newtype RoutingControlState
RoutingControlState' :: Text -> RoutingControlState
[fromRoutingControlState] :: RoutingControlState -> Text
pattern RoutingControlState_Off :: RoutingControlState
pattern RoutingControlState_On :: RoutingControlState

-- | A routing control state.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRoutingControlStateEntry</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateRoutingControlStateEntry

--   optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   <a>updateRoutingControlStateEntry_routingControlState</a> - The
--   routing control state in a set of routing control state entries.
newUpdateRoutingControlStateEntry :: Text -> RoutingControlState -> UpdateRoutingControlStateEntry
